poem:
**State of the Climate**

In the din of words,  
a fragile echo—  
net zero,  
unbound from consensus,  
floats on politic winds.  
Leaves whisper green promises,  
while autumn beckons brown.  
Science stands, an orphan,  
in a room of turned backs.  
Yet the earth keeps spinning,  
an ancient clock—  
ticking, ticking  
softly underfoot.
